[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Rust] [Integer Overflow] Are arithmetic operations on scalars checked for overflow, or can integer overflow cause key material corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Rust] [Panic Safety] Can panics during encryption/decryption leave the system in an inconsistent state, causing validator failures or state corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Rust] [Lifetime Issues] Can lifetime mismanagement cause use-after-free or dangling reference issues with key material or group elements? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Rust] [Clone/Copy Semantics] Does improper Clone or Copy implementation on sensitive types cause unintended duplication of key material in memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Rust] [Drop Implementation] Are Drop implementations for sensitive types (keys, scalars) properly implemented to zeroize memory on deallocation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Rust] [Send/Sync Safety] Can incorrect Send/Sync bounds on types enable race conditions when keys or RNG state is shared across threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Rust] [Default Trait] Does implementing Default for key types accidentally create zero or weak default keys that could be exploited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Dependencies] [curve25519-dalek Vulnerabilities] Does the implementation depend on vulnerable versions of curve25519-dalek or other crypto libraries with known CVEs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Dependencies] [RNG Dependencies] Are CryptoRng and RngCore implementations from trusted sources, or can supply chain attacks inject backdoored RNGs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Dependencies] [Dependency Updates] Does Aptos regularly update cryptographic dependencies to patch vulnerabilities, or can outdated dependencies expose validators to attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Testing] [Test Coverage] Does test_keygen_enc_dec provide sufficient coverage of edge cases, or can untested code paths harbor security vulnerabilities? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Testing] [Fuzzing] Has the ElGamal implementation been fuzzed with malformed inputs to discover crashes or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Testing] [Formal Verification] Has the cryptographic correctness of the implementation been formally verified to prevent subtle mathematical errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Testing] [Security Audit] Has the ElGamal module undergone independent security audit by cryptography experts to identify vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Configuration] [Parameter Selection] Are group parameters (curve choice, generator, order) hardcoded securely, or can configuration errors weaken security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Configuration] [Runtime Configuration] Can validators configure crypto parameters at runtime, potentially choosing weak settings that compromise security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Deployment] [Key Distribution] How are ElGamal public keys distributed among validators - can man-in-the-middle attacks substitute malicious keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Deployment] [Backward Compatibility] Can changes to the ElGamal implementation break compatibility with existing keys or ciphertexts causing validator disagreement? (High)
